gwt.material.design.client.ui

Class MaterialModal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
        • gwt.material.design.client.ui.MaterialModal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasAttachHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasVisibility, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget

    public class MaterialModal
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
    Dialogs are content that are not original visible on a page but show up with extra information if needed. The transitions should make the appearance of the dialog make sense and not jarring to the user.

    UiBinder Usage:

      
    MaterialModal.showModal(new ModalContent(), ModalType.DEFAULT, false);
    MaterialModal.showModal(new ModalContent(), ModalType.FIXED_FOOTER, false);
    MaterialModal.showModal(new ModalContent(), ModalType.BOTTOM_SHEET, false);
    MaterialModal.showModal(new ModalContent(), ModalType.WINDOW, false);

    Parameters

    Widget - a widget to attach inside modal
    ModalType - type of modal
    AutoHideEnabled - if true then clicking outside will hide the modal

    Author:
    kevzlou7979, Ben Dol
    See Also:
    Material Badge

    • Method Detail

      • showModal

        public static void showModal(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget composite,
                             ModalType type,
                             boolean autoHideEnabled)
        Show the modal with composite as a content of the modal
        Parameters:
        type - - Type of modal: FIXED_FOOTER, BOTTOM_SHEET, DEFAULT, WINDOW
        composite - - the content of the modal could be any kind of widgets
        autoHideEnabled - - set true if you want to be your modal closable when clicking outside

      • showWindow

        public static void showWindow(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget composite,
                              ModalType type,
                              String title,
                              String headerColor,
                              boolean autoHideEnabled)
        Show the window with composite as a content of the modal Its an advance modal with advance features to be added inside like MaterialNavBar, MaterialTabs etc.
        Parameters:
        composite - - the content of the modal could be any kind of widgets
        type - - Type of modal: WINDOW
        title - - Window title of the modal
        headerColor - - the color theme of the modal
        autoHideEnabled - - set true if you want to be your modal closable when clicking outside
